content:
Hey, @bors r+ timed out on my Clippy PR and I noticed that also other PRs in the Homu queue seem to be stuck in the pending status. Could it be that Homu is stuck somewhere? :upside_down:
(Sorry, if this is not the correct stream to ask this :sweat_smile: )

GitHub doesn't report any problems GitHub Dashboard and Clippy had a PR running tests using GitHub Actions without a problem just 1.5 hours ago. (It could be that they are unrelated though :thinking: )
Sorry and fixed, I misspell them sometimes -.-
No worries; I edited the topic title so that other people would know what it was about, figured I'd chime in with what I did and why.
I've got PRs in stdarch which have been stuck in the CI queue for 3+ hours already: https://github.com/rust-lang/stdarch/pull/1108/checks?check_run_id=2270058550
the only thing I can think of is that we are hitting the limits on our github org in terms of concurrent builders running at once, but that would be... surprising
I'm not sure there's any nice way to tell if that's the case on our end
Merging seems to be working again. It's slower than usual but Clippy now has two PRs which got merged with a retry.
